results.title: Swoon
results.brief_description: Tom Kalin’s first feature is a stylish and challenging interpretation of the 1924 kidnapping and murder of a young boy by Chicago’s famous lovers Nathan Leopold and Richard Loeb. Although based on court transcripts and archival research, the fractured narrative and experimental format are utilized to question the mythology of the ‘pathological’ homosexual and to reorder history as it was reported.

results.title: Betty Blue = 37.2 Le Matin
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Claudie Ossard, Cargo Films and Constellation
results.brief_description: A contemporary tale of ‘amour fou’ based on the novel by Phillipe Djian, “Betty blue” is the story of Zorg (Jean-Hugues Anglade) who at 31 has accepted a certain measure of resignation, and the beautiful, passionate nineteen year old Betty (Beatrice Dalle), who dramatically enters his life and proceeds to dismantle his complacency with her volatile, urgent nature. Betty and Zorg’s life together is dominated by Betty’s fearless embracing of whatever emotion or new circumstance presents itself. This propels them both into a series of events and encounters by turns comic and poignant. Betty’s restlessness and her ever-worsening mental illness finds a focus in Zorg. She decides he is a brilliant writer and she sets about despatching his diaries to potential publishers. In the face of disappointment, however, Betty’s increasingly extreme reactions begin to reveal an instinct for self-destruction that Zorg is helpless to subdue. French language with English subtitles.

results.title: Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Koreyoshi Kurahara, Koretsugu Kurahara, Masaru Kakutani, Fuji Telecasting, Gakken Company and Kurahoa Productions
results.brief_description: The year is 1958. The men of the first Japanese Antarctic expedition are expecting to be relieved by another party on board the ice breaker ‘Soya’. A fierce blizzard erupts and the ‘Soya’ is unable to reach base camp. A small plane is used to ferry the men of the first expedition back to the ice breaker. The men, believing the second party to be on its way, left behind fifteen sled dogs which were chained to posts embedded in ice. This is the incredible true story of these sled dogs and their struggle to survive an Antarctic winter. Narrated by Robert Wagner and music by Vangelis.

results.title: The Last Metro = Le Derniere Metro
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Les Films Carrosse, S A -TF1, SEDIF and SFP
results.brief_description: It is Paris, 1942, under the German Occupation, and successful Jewish theatrical director, Lucas Steiner, is forced into hiding. He entrusts the running of the theatre to his wife Marion, who must contend with Daxiat, a pro-Nazi critic. Masterful direction by Truffaut captures the climate of the occupation.

results.title: The Godfather
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Albert Ruddy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s epic masterpiece features Oscar winner Marlon Brando as the patriarch of the Corleone family. Coppola paints a chilling portrait of a Sicilian family’s rise and near fall from power in America, and the passage of rites from father to son. He masterfully balances the story between family life and the ugly business of crime in which they are engaged. Based on Mario Puzo’ best selling novel, this graphic and brilliant film garnered ten Academy Award nominations. Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

results.title: Red river
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisholm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever made, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Hans Christian Andersen
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: The incredibly multi-talented Danny Kaye stars as Hans Christian Andersen, a young cobbler with a special gift for storytelling. We first see Hans in his home town of Odense, Denmark, entertaining the village children with his fascinating tales - much to the displeasure of the schoolmaster. Hans takes off for Copenhagen where he falls hopelessly in love with a ballerina, only to discover she is already married. However, this unrequited love inspires a spectacular 17 minute ballet, “The Little Mermaid”, that is one of the highlights of the film. Finally Hans returns home to the acclaim of his fellow townsfolk. Nominated for six Academy Awards, it is a visual and musical delight with an imaginative score. You will be enchanted by this entertaining and much-loved family film that has delighted both young and old for over forty years.

results.title: The Last picture show
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Stephen J. Friedman, BBS Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: Released in 1971 to critical acclaim and public controversy, this modern day classic directed by Peter Bogdanovich garnered eight Academy Award nominations (including Best Picture). It was hailed as “the most important work by a young director since Citizen Kane”. A frank, bittersweet drama of social and sexual mores in small-town Texas featuring a cast led by Timothy Bottoms, Jeff Bridges and Cybill Shepherd in her debut role. Cloris Leachman and Ben Johnson each won Oscars for their work in supporting roles. The characters created by Larry McMurty in his compelling novel are vividly brought to life in one of the most engaging coming-of-age stories ever filmed.

results.title: Murder
results.brief_description: This film deals with one of Hitchcock’s favourite themes - an innocent person being falsely accused. The innocent person is a woman accused of murdering her friend. The jury have sentenced the accused, but one jury member disagrees, which requires the piecing together of a highly complex jigsaw puzzle. Cast includes Nora Baring, Phyllis Konstam, Edward Chapman and Miles Mander.

results.title: River's edge
results.creator_credit: Tim Hunter, Midge Sanford, Sarah Pillsbury and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film is a story of today’s teenagers poised perilously on the brink between adolescence and adulthood. When one of them murders his girl-friend, the others must decide for themselves which is more important - admitting knowledge of a dreadful deed, or staying loyal to a close friend. They do not know how to react and their plight is one with which everyone - young and old - can identify. It is an extraordinary document of teen life today, showing how adolescents can seem almost numbed by even the most intense, extreme situations. This film is disturbing, thought-provoking and based on a real-life incident. WARNING: SOME SCENES IN THIS FILM MAY BE DISTURBING TO SOME VIEWERS.
